Class ParserFactory

java.lang.Object
edu.rit.g2.factory.ParserFactory
public class ParserFactory extends Object
A factory class responsible for creating appropriate SchemaParser implementations based on an input schema format.

This class follows the Factory Method design pattern, centralizing the logic for parser creation. Rather than instantiating parser classes directly, client code calls get(String) to retrieve the correct parser depending on the selected schema type.

Supported formats:

  • json → JsonSchemaParser
  • xml → XmlSchemaParser

If an unsupported or invalid format is provided, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. This ensures early failure and clear feedback for the user or calling component.

The class is implemented as a non-instantiable utility class — all methods are static, and the constructor is private.

Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • get

      public static SchemaParser get(String format)
      Returns an appropriate SchemaParser implementation based on the provided format string.

      The format lookup is case-insensitive. Valid examples:

          ParserFactory.get("json");
    ParserFactory.get("XML");
    ParserFactory.get("Json");
      Parameters:
      format - the schema format to parse (e.g., "json", "xml"); must not be null
      Returns:
      a corresponding SchemaParser instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if format is null or does not match any supported type
